title: So, is my poor Nidalee a vastaya now?
body: Has she gone from "Tarzan with a magical shapeshifter turn" to "Korean mmorpg girl"?

replies.body: those two roles aren't mutually exclusive...
So you are upset,because her powers likely have a known origin now instead of being random transformation powers with no real explanation?

> [{quoted}](name=GreenLore,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=4Zc9IEuo,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-04-04T10:04:19.721+0000)
>
> So you are upset,because her powers likely have a known origin now instead of being random transformation powers with no real explanation?


I am uset because now there are dozens like her. Yet her powers are still pretty much unexplained.
They explained in the new lore piece that Vastaya/human hybrids can end up as humans with the ability to transform into an animalistic form,which would easily explain Nidalees power.
I'd argue that this gives Riot a better chance to make her stand out as an individual based on who she is rather than what she is if she turns out to be a Vastaya.

I have had the same thought, similar to my thoughts of how the Ascending of shurima could be a ritual that forces generations of evolution to happen within a short time and turns them into a form of Vastaya....... Im curious how this is going to turn out tbh.
I wouldn't call the ascended beings Vastaya. They're effectively immortal and have near godlike power. They aren't really mortal, which Vastaya probably are.
